Dear Ms. Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 734-395-0920.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth uses sexually inappropriate language toward staff member
and staff member does not respond appropriately or address the
behavior. Youth has threatened to expose staff member for being
sexually inappropriate with other staff on their shift in exchange for
staff changing her behavior logs. Staff member has allowed youth
to touch their breasts.
Investigation This complaint was received on 3/11/23 and jointly investigated
with the Government Worker. The complaint noted the following:
Youth A (15) resides at Vista Maria and is in foster care.
Supervisor A is a staff member at Vista Maria. Youth A indicated
that Supervisor A is her "girlfriend." Youth A makes sexual in
nature comments to Supervisor A and Supervisor A laughs them
off. Youth A has indicated things, such as, asking if she buys
"Victoria Secret panties" and asked Supervisor A "did your braces
get caught around his dick" referring to a male staff member that
Supervisor A is in a relationship with. Supervisor A is changing the
behavior logs to cover up Youth A’s behavior, so Youth A does not
get in trouble. If Supervisor A wouldn't change the behavioral logs,
Youth A has threatened to "expose her," meaning tell other staff
about Supervisor A’s relationship, including that Youth A has
witnessed her sexually rubbing on the other male staff member
while they were both working. Supervisor A has also allowed
Youth A to touch her breasts and quickly redirected her at the time
of the incident. After that incident, Supervisor A will no longer let
Youth A touch her.
2

The complainant was a staff member and prefers not to be
identified. Follow up with the complainant was not able to be
completed as there was no contact information provided.
The foster care worker was notified of the investigation on 3/10/23
and had no additional information to provide.
I interviewed Youth A on 3/15/23 at the facility in collaboration with
the Government Worker. Youth A reported she has pet names for
several of her peers and staff. She said she calls Supervisor A by
her first name and then adds the word baby, baby cakes or cakes
to the end of it. She also reported she calls one of the other youth
daughter. Youth A reported several youth call the supervisor baby
cakes or cakes. Youth A denied she has called Supervisor A her
girlfriend or that she has seen Supervisor A rub up against a male
staff or touch a male staff inappropriately. Youth A denied using
sexually inappropriate language toward Supervisor A. Youth A
reported she has never spoken to Supervisor A about Victoria
Secret underwear or made any comments about her braces and a
male staff member. Youth A denied that she ever touched
Supervisor A's breasts. Youth A reported she got accused of
touching Supervisor A's buttocks in the past and therefore is not
allowed to hug Supervisor A. Youth A reported after this incident
she had to have a meeting with her therapist and Supervisor A to
discuss what happened and to apologize for touching Supervisor
A's buttocks. Youth A reported she has never asked Supervisor A
to change the logging on her behavior. Youth A did not know
what a log was and had to ask what a behavior log is.
Supervisor A was interviewed in person at the facility on 3/23/23 in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Supervisor A reported
Youth A is often inappropriate with female staff. Supervisor A
reported that Youth A makes female staff and even volunteers
uncomfortable. Supervisor A reported that Youth A calls her
babe, baby cakes and wife. Supervisor A reported that she
redirects her, but the redirection does not work. Supervisor A
reported she does not allow Youth A to make sexual comments to
her and redirects her. Supervisor A reported she would prefer not
to be around Youth A and that she cannot control what comes out
of Youth A's mouth. Supervisor A denied that Youth A has
touched her breasts, but she has touched her butt. Supervisor A
reported that Youth A asks for hugs frequently and in December
she hugged Youth A who then ran her hand down Supervisor A's
back and to her butt. Supervisor A denied that she has ever
rubbed up against a male coworker or that she has a relationship
with any coworkers. Supervisor A denied ever changing the
3

behavior logs on behalf of Youth A or that Youth A was forcing her
to do it by having information on her. Supervisor A reported, "I
would never let a kid play with me like that". Supervisor A then
began to cry and was upset that anyone would say these things
about her. Supervisor A reported that Youth A has made
comments about her Victoria Secret underwear after seeing
Supervisor A's panty line one day. Supervisor A reported Youth A
just kept talking about it and she redirected and ignored her
comments. Supervisor A denied that Youth A has ever made any
statements about Supervisor A's braces getting caught on a male
coworker’s private parts.
A review of Supervisor A’s personnel file was completed, and she
does not have performance write ups for misconduct with youth.
DOCUMENTATION REVIEWED:
Review of incident report dated 12/24/22 authored by Supervisor
A. Incident report details an incident involving Youth A and
Supervisor A. Youth A hugged Supervisor A and during the
interaction Youth A ran her hand down Supervisor A's back down
to her buttocks. Supervisor A snatched away from Youth A. Youth
A blocked the door so that Supervisor A could not leave and was
repeatedly saying I am sorry. Youth A eventually let her leave the
wing.
Analysis Based upon interviews there is no evidence that supports
Supervisor A has or had inappropriate contact with Youth A, that
she allowed Youth A to touch her or that she engaged in
inappropriate conversations with Youth A. Youth A and
Supervisor A denied that Supervisor A is in a relationship with a
male staff or that she rubbed up against a male staff. Youth A and
Supervisor A denied that Supervisor A changes the behavior logs.
There is no evidence that Supervisor A does not have the
experience to perform the duties of her position. Youth A and
Supervisor A denied all allegations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & R 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
4

Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth was restrained and slammed on the bed by staff.
Investigation During the course of the original investigation, Youth A made a
report of inappropriate restraint. Youth A reported she was
physically fighting with Youth B when Team Leader 1 grabbed her
and put her in her room. Youth A reported Team Leader 1
slammed her onto her bed with his full body weight and landed on
top of her. Youth A reported she had sore ribs from this incident
and asked to see the nurse the next day. Youth A reported she
saw the nurse who gave her Ibuprofen. Youth A reported she kept
coming out of her room to re-engage in the fight which frustrated
Team Leader 1. Youth A reported Team Leader 1 pressed both of
her arms against the sides of her body and squeezed hard to
move her to her room. Youth A reported she was locked in her
room "a long time". Youth A reported she told Supervisor B "you
saw him slam me and didn't say anything".
Youth A also reported she and Team Leader 1 also got into an
argument about food. Youth A felt the food served was cold and
wanted to microwave her food. Youth A became frustrated with
Team Leader 1 over this topic and threw her plate of food at him
and spit on him. A ‘no contact’ between Youth A and Team
Leader 1 was created at that time.
I attempted to interview Team Leader 1, on 3/15/23, at the facility
with the Government Worker. He refused to talk and indicated it
was not a good day and he didn't want to say something he
regretted. He agreed to an interview the next week.
Team Leader 1 was interviewed on 3/23/23. He has been
employed at the facility for five years. Team Leader 1 reported
Youth A got into an altercation with a peer, and he went on the
wing to assist. Team Leader 1 reported Youth A kept trying to
come at Youth B and he was trying to block Youth A so that she
could not re-engage in a fight with Youth B. Team Leader 1
reported he escorted Youth A to her room, and she was fighting
him trying to get back out of her room. Team Leader 1 reported
he was blocking and trying to keep Youth A from leaving her room
and she was fighting back trying to pinch and hit him. Team
Leader 1 reported that he tripped over Youth A's feet or shoes and
landed on her bed on top of her. Team Leader 1 reported he got
up and backed out of the room. While he was attempting to back
out of Youth A's room, she was hitting his chest and tried to bite
him. Team Leader 1 reported he did not interact with Youth A the
rest of his shift. Team Leader 1 was emotional and indicated
5

Youth A calls him Dad and he doesn't understand how Youth A
can act like this. Team Leader 1 reported they shut Youth A's door
and held it shut to keep Youth A from coming out and to calm
down. Team Leader 1 indicated they did not lock her door.
Team Leader 1 described how he escorted Youth A. He reported
he held her wrist and Supervisor B held the other wrist. Team
Leader 1 reported he could not remember which side he was on
and at one-point Supervisor B had to let go as they all couldn't fit
through Youth A's door. Team Leader 1 reported he went into
Youth A's room as she was punching to get out and was grabbing
at him and tried to bite him. Team Leader 1 reported he did not
restrain Youth A as he was backing out of her room and did not
want to be the aggressor as he felt it would turn into something
worse if they restrained her. Team Leader 1 reported when youth
fight they intervene right away as they can’t let kids fight one
another.
Team Leader 1 reported that the next day he was working, and
Youth A asked to use the microwave to heat up her food. Youth A
was told she couldn't put her plate of food in the microwave as it
was not a microwave safe plate. Youth A asked for a form to
report concerns to the Rights Officer. Team Leader 1 indicated
he told Youth A "yes that is what it’s for" referring to the form
request. Team Leader 1 reported Youth A responded with "shut
the fuck up I am going to get you fired" and then threw her plate of
food on him and then spit in his face. Team Leader 1 reported
that Youth A went back to the wing, and he went home after that.
He said that Youth A spitting in his face was very upsetting for
him. He reported the food on his clothes was not as big a deal as
he could just change clothes.
Supervisor B was interviewed at the facility on 3/23/23 in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Supervisor B has
worked at the facility for 13 years. Supervisor B reported that
Youth A got into a fight with Youth B and the staff separated them.
Supervisor B reported she was not called down to the wing but
overheard all the noise and came to the area. Supervisor B
reported that Youth A was with Youth Coach 1 and Youth A kept
getting away from her to re-engage in a fight with Youth B.
Supervisor B reported she stepped in to assist with managing
Youth A. Supervisor B reported they got Youth A to her room and
then she got back out. Supervisor B and Team Leader 1 were
trying to get her to stop going at Youth B. Supervisor B reported
she and Team Leader 1 got Youth A to her room by guiding and
pushing her into her room. Supervisor B reported they were
blocking her from exiting with their bodies. Supervisor B reported
6

they never restrained Youth A. Supervisor B reported that when
they were getting Youth A into her room, she was fighting Team
Leader 1 and he tripped and fell onto her bed and on top of Youth
A. Supervisor B reported that Youth A told her Team Leader 1
slammed her onto the bed. Supervisor B reported he tripped and
fell on top of her. Supervisor B reported Youth A kept coming at
Team Leader 1 and would not stop. Supervisor B reported that
when Team Leader 1 was able to exit Youth A 's room she held
Youth A's door shut for a few minutes and Youth A kept pushing
on the door trying to get out. Supervisor B reported she kept the
door mostly shut when Team Leader 1 was inside Youth A's
bedroom as she was trying to keep Youth A from exiting and was
trying to allow Team Leader 1 to exit the room. Supervisor B
reported Team Leader 1 was trying to get out and Youth A was
hitting his chest and trying to pinch his nipples. Supervisor B
reported Youth A started to calm down eventually. Supervisor B
reported when youth engage in a physical fight they are to
intervene immediately and are not supposed to let the youth fight.
Youth Coach 1 was interviewed on 3/23/23 at the facility in
collaboration with the Government Worker. She has been
employed at the facility for the past year. Youth Coach 1 reported
that she went off the wing to get water for Youth B. When she
returned, Youth Coach 1 reported that Youth A and Youth B were
arguing and told one another to "shut the fuck up" and then
started swinging on each other. Youth Coach 1 reported she got
up and separated the two girls. Youth Coach 1 reported Youth B
and Youth A got away from staff and the girls got a couple of hits
in when Supervisor B and Team Leader 1 came. Youth Coach 1
reported that Supervisor B and Team Leader 1 took over. Youth
Coach 1 reported that Youth B had stopped fighting and was
following direction and Youth A kept trying to come out of her
room, so staff leaned on the door to keep her from coming out.
Youth Coach 1 reported they did not lock the door but stood in
front of it to keep her in. Youth Coach 1 reported that none of the
girls were restrained. Youth Coach 1 reported they are not allowed
to restrain youth. Youth Coach 1 reported they intervene when
youth fight.
Youth Coach 2 was interviewed at the facility on 2/23/23 in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Youth Coach 2 has
been employed with the facility since June 2022. Youth Coach 2
reported she was working on A wing, and she stepped off the wing
to heat up her food and when she came back onto the wing Youth
A and B were arguing and the situation escalated to a physical
altercation. Youth Coach 2 reported Supervisor B and Team
7

Leader 1 arrived and assisted. Youth Coach 2 reported she
escorted Youth B down the hall with both of Youth B's hands held
behind her back. Youth Coach 2 reported that Youth A kept trying
to come back down the hall at Youth B. Youth Coach 2 reported
she never heard Youth A say she got hurt by Team Leader 1.
She reported that Youth A was mad at Supervisor B and Team
Leader 1 as they kept blocking her. Youth Coach 2 reported that
Team Leader 1 and Supervisor B held Youth A's door shut but it
was not locked. Youth Coach 2 reported that they are not allowed
to restrain youth.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 3/23/23 in collaboration
with the Government Worker. Youth B came into the room after
being encouraged but indicated she did not want to talk. Youth B
reported she and Youth A got into a fight and staff broke it up. She
reported that staff grabbed her by the arm and kept her by her
door. Youth B reported she listened to staff and did not try to
continue to fight. Youth B reported Youth A kept trying to come out
and smack her. Youth B denied that Team Leader 1 has ever
harmed her. Youth B reported that Supervisor B will hold one of
her arms up behind her back and pushes it up. Youth B reported
when Supervisor B does this, she tells her it hurts and to stop but
she keeps doing it. Youth B did not identify a specific incident,
location, or date when Supervisor B did this. Youth B denied that
any other staff curse at her or harm her.
I interviewed Supervisor B again on 4/19/23 via phone. Supervisor
B denied ever holding Youth B’s arm behind her back and lifting
up. Supervisor B reported she has not had an incident where she
has escorted or restrained Youth B that she can recall in the past
three months. She did report a restraint of Youth B in the
bathroom that resulted in them falling to the floor some time ago.
Supervisor B could not remember the date of the incident.
The rights officer was interviewed via phone on 4/19/23. He
reported no recent incident reports have been made regarding
Supervisor B holding a youth’s arm behind their back and pushing
up. He further reported approximately 18 months to 2 years ago
there was a client’s rights complaint made by a youth indicating
Supervisor B held her arm behind her back and lifted up. An
internal investigation was completed and was not substantiated.
The rights officer reported on 4/13/23 via phone that Supervisor B
was placed on final disciplinary action for the restraint and
seclusion of Youth A. If she has any further incidents it will result
8

in termination of employment. This is the only performance
violation in her file.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 3/23/23 in collaboration
with the Government Worker. Youth C was reluctant to enter the
room or to talk. Youth C warmed up quickly and wanted to report
the things she thinks are not good at the facility. Youth C reported
her finger got bent back during the fight. Youth C reported that
Team Leader 1 slammed Youth A onto her bed and that she
heard it but didn’t see it. Youth C reported Youth A told her about
it and told her that her body was sore all over. Youth C reported
that Supervisor B is good at calming the girls down. Youth C
reported that Youth A would not calm down that night as her hair
got pulled out. Youth C denied that she is in a relationship with
Youth A and that they are besties.
Youth C reported staff are not going to break up a fight and tell
them they can fight it out. Youth C reported that they let fights
happen as they don't care and are on their cell phones. Youth C
reported when Youth A and Youth B fought, she jumped in as the
staff were not breaking up the fight.
VIDEO REVIEW:
Video footage from 3/12/23 of Wing A was reviewed on 3/15/23.
The video begins with Youth A being brought to her room by
Team Leader 1. Team Leader 1 is standing behind Youth A and
he is holding Youth A's arms behind her back. Youth A's feet are
on the ground, and she is moving forward. When they get to the
doorway of her room Team Leader 1 let’s go of Youth A's arms
and releases Youth A into her room. Youth A stumbles almost
falling to the ground. Youth A is able to catch herself from falling
and turns around and attempts to exit her room. Team Leader 1
and Supervisor B are now at the doorway to Youth A's room.
Team Leader 1 blocks Youth A's attempts to exit her room.
Supervisor B is standing at the door holding the door open. Team
Leader 1 is using his body to block Youth A with his shoulder
down. He pushes her back into the room and then enters her
room. Supervisor B is standing at the door holding the door
slightly open, but one cannot see inside the room as the door
blocks the camera view. Supervisor B has the doorway cracked
and is positioned to see what is going on inside the room. The
footage only shows Supervisor 2 holding the door almost shut and
there is no way to see what is going on inside the room. Team
Leader 1 is in the bedroom with Youth A for approximately one
minute. It appears during that time they are tussling as you can
see a small glimpse of their movement through the slim long
9

window on the door. Supervisor B keeps the door almost closed
when this is going on. Team Leader 1 exits the room and video,
and Supervisor B then holds the door shut with her foot and body
weight for approximately 4 minutes. Then Team Leader 1 returns
to hold the door shut with his foot and body weight for
approximately 2 minutes. Youth A can be seen charging at the
door attempting to push it open unsuccessfully.
DOCUMENTATION REVIEWED:
Review of incident report dated 3/12/23 authored by Supervisor B.
Incident report details the fight between Youth A and Youth B.
Youth B was swearing at Youth A and refused to step down to
personal time. Segregation for safety was called. Youth B pushed
Youth A who in return punched Youth B in the face. The girls then
began to exchange closed fist punches. Youth B pulled out one of
Youth A's braids and hair. Team Leader 1 escorted Youth A to her
room and Youth A continued to push and hit Team Leader 1.
Team Leader 1 and Youth A entered her room and she continued
to be aggressive causing herself and Team Leader 1 to trip, falling
onto Youth A's bed. Team Leader 1 immediately got up and left
Youth A's room. Youth A immediately began to try to leave her
room to get to Youth B. Youth A was punching, pinching and
biting Team Leader 1 as he backed his way out of the door. Team
Leader 1 and Supervisor 2 blocked Youth A from leaving her
room.
Review of incident report dated 3/13/23 authored by Youth Coach
3. Incident report details an incident between Youth A and Team
Leader 1. Wing A was getting their food and Youth A indicated
the food was cold. She attempted to microwave food on an unsafe
plate. She became angry and threw her plate of food at Team
Leader 1 and spit on his face.
Document review-Behavior Management Policy says one person
restraint is prohibited.
Document review-Nursing note dated 3/13/23 authored by Medical
Staff. Youth A was seen at Beata after being physically managed
the day before. There is superficial scratch on her left shoulder
about 1.5 inches long. Youth A reports left shoulder pain. There is
no swelling or bruising to the shoulder and Youth A has full range
of motion. Youth A reports shoulder is painful to the touch. Youth
A reported pain around both ribs and a frontal headache from
being slammed down on her bed. No bump to head was reported.
PRN 600 Ibuprofen prescribed and follow up in 3 days.
10

Document review-Nursing note dated 3/16/23 authored by Medical
Staff. Youth has had left shoulder pain for 1 week. Youth A
reported it stopped hurting today. Youth A reported being
slammed onto bed by staff about 4 days ago. Youth A reports
feeling better. The shoulder area is mildly tender to palpation.
Youth A has full range of motion of left shoulder.
Analysis Based upon interviews and video footage there is evidence that
supports Youth A was inappropriately restrained in a one-person
technique and pushed into her room by Team Leader 1. Youth
Counselor 2 also reported she performed a one-person restraint
with Youth B by holding Youth B's hands behind her back when
moving her to her room. These actions are not in line with the
facility’s restraint model.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE: Some of the staff interviewed
reported they were not allowed to restrain children any longer.
When youth are a danger to themselves and others it can be
necessary and appropriate to restrain a youth using the facility’s
approved physical management model. The agency should clarify
this with staff.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure
Section facilities; seclusion plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
Description (11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff secluded youth in her room to keep her from fighting with a
peer.
Investigation See full interview notes and video review in the above section on
restraint. Youth A, Supervisor B, Team Leader 1, Youth Coach 1,
and Youth Coach 2 all reported Youth A's door was held shut by
staff to keep her from exiting her room.
Video footage from 3/12/23 of Wing A was reviewed and shows
Supervisor B and Team Leader 1 holding Youth A's bedroom door
shut for approximately 6 minutes.
DOCUMENTATION REVIEWED:
The agency’s behavior management policy specifies that
seclusion, preventing a client's egress from the designated area,
will not be utilized.
Analysis Based upon interviews and video footage there is evidence that
supports Youth A was secluded in her room by Supervisor B and
11

Team Leader 1 for a total of six minutes. This is not in line with
the agency policy or licensing rules.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4407 Facility and premises maintenance.
Section (1) A facility and premises shall be maintained in a clean,
Description comfortable, and safe condition. The facility shall be located on
land that is properly drained.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The shower curtains have black mold growing on them.
Investigation During the course of this investigation, Youth A and Youth C
reported that the shower curtains in their bathroom showers have
black mold growing on them.
A tour of the facility’s showers and shower curtains on 3/15/23 did
confirm that both shower curtains had significant black mold
growing on them.
Analysis Based upon interviews and observation of the shower curtains
there is evidence of mold growing on the shower curtains. This
does not provide a clean, comfortable environment for the youth.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
